Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, after this battle, I would like to discuss my new plans.
Plans?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hmm... I wonder how I'd even go about doing this?
Émile? Are you in my quarters again?
Oui! Entrez, Capitaine!
Thanks for inviting me - to my own room. What were you mumbling about?
Potential upgrades to myself... the usual...
What are you thinking of exactly?
I want to fuse myself with a Morgana vessel.
Come again?
Think of it. We could really learn about their technology... all we need is a volunteer. That's where I come in!

Fields.MenuText: Are you out of your mind?! There's no way I'd allow that to happen, Émile! It's far too dangerous!
You're not going to give this up... should I even bother mentioning how this would affect the crew?
If you really want this... then we have to have a long chat about the potential consequences.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing in war is safe, sir. We can't ignore every opportunity thrown our way.
I've already thought about that. Nothing that a reassuring speech from the beloved Capitaine couldn't fix!
I know, sir. I have it all planned out...
I'm still far from convinced.
Morgana sighting, sir.
All crew to your stations.
@BATTLE
So about your idea of "upgrading" yourself...
I'm glad you're deciding to bring this up! I thought that I'd have to start the discussion!

Fields.MenuText: The sooner this is sorted out, the sooner you can get back to focusing on the enemy. Now, Émile. How would we do this?
I'm concerned about how this could earn you a trip to the scrapyard. Has anyone ever done this before?
Do you know how long we'd be decommissioned? We can't afford to be sitting any battle out.

Fields.DialogueText: It wouldn't be too difficult, sir. As long as people follow my blueprints, then the risk of failure would be minimal!
No Belle has done this as far as I'm aware of... mais, there's nothing wrong with being first!
It wouldn't be anything that would hamper our ability to fight. We'd be approaching this carefully, sir. Now let me explain.
You appear to believe that I would be replacing a majority of the ship with Morgana parts.
Right...
Non. Not only would that take an enormous amount of time, we'd need to dismantle an entire Morgana vessel for that. What we would do instead is utilize everything I have at the moment.
You mean those scraps that you collect?
They're not random chunks of metal, Capitaine. I have some pieces from their targeting systems, hunks of weaponry, things that would enhance what we have at our disposal.
So you'd attach it all at once? Do we even know that you'd be compatible with these parts?
As long as their ships are the same model as me, I don't see the issue. They've got an edge on us, and I want to figure out why...
You know, Capitaine. I never got your input on the matter...
My input on what?
My plan for upgrading myself with Morgana tech! Certainment, you've discussed it with me, but I've never heard from you if it was worth doing!
Does it matter that much? Besides, this is still just talking about it. This hasn't been approved, Émile.
I know that, sir. Do you think that there's a chance that we could go through with it?

Fields.MenuText: I see the potential, but I still have my doubts about it. I don't think we've identified all the risks.
I wouldn't do it without crew input, and I don't think they'd be enthused.
Émile... I'm just worried about what could happen to you... so I'm hesitant about all of this.

Fields.DialogueText: Je comprends...
I can always help you with that! They trust you, sir!
Your concern is appreciated, Capitaine. But you need to trust me!
I suppose we'll cross that bridge when we get there.
@BATTLE
Formidable! That sounds like a definite "maybe" to me!
*ALARM*
What do you think?
Of what?
About the Morganas' loadout in the field... well... the sea...
It just seems like standard weaponry to me - and there were some cases where the guns were obviously stolen from human ships.
Are you sure about that? They have a tendency to hit much harder than us. Even when we're against the same type of vessel...
You think that they've got something more than just endurance?
They have to... it's not too crazy to think that, sir. Is it?

Fields.MenuText: You have a point. Not too crazy to think that they may be more than just tough...
I don't know...
When we see it, I'll believe it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm just suggesting that maybe it's something worth looking into.
I don't either... that makes it exciting! We'll find out all their secrets eventually!
I can understand that!
Donc... think we could get an extra close look at their weapons?
I'm not sure about that...
Je vous en prie, we'll be quick!
@BATTLE
If those shapes on the horizon are what I think they are, you'll get a close look right now - battle stations!
I've been curious lately, Émile.
Nothing wrong with curiosity! De quoi?
Why you seem to be the only Belle I've ever heard of that wants to integrate with the Morganas.
Perhaps I'm the only one who sees the possibilities!
That's true. But I've never heard of a Belle, or anyone, who's trusting enough to add a piece of Morgana tech to them without any obvious safeguards.
Hmm... I can't really explain that.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean by that?
You don't know why? I'm having trouble believing that.
I bet you can... think, Émile!

Fields.DialogueText: I mean that I don't know, sir. I guess I'm just interested...
I honestly don't, Capitaine. I'm curious, just like you!
Hmm... I got nothing...
You really don't have any idea as to why you're so fascinated by the Morganas?
Non. Not a clue!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I wonder where Émile is? She wasn't on the bridge...
Émile? Where are you? Are you in my quarters again?
Sleeping... Émile!
Ahh! Are we under attack?! Did I forget to eat again?!
Nothing of the sort. You just fell asleep. In my quarters. Again.
Ugh... Je suis désolée, Capitaine... I just thought I'd catch up on some of the missing hours of sleep.
Have you had trouble getting to bed lately?
It's not too out of the ordinary. I keep forgetting that too much caffeine will keep me wired...

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure it's just from drinking coffee? Do you have something on your mind?
You gotta be more careful, Émile. I can't babysit you all the time.
Can't you find somewhere else to sleep, at least?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing unusual, if that's what you're wondering. I'm just thinking about potential upgrades.
Je sais. I'll try to be more careful next time.
But it's so quiet in here...
If you're asleep at the wheel, we could end up being surprised by--
*ALARM*
Oh, that was loud! But you were saying, Capitaine? Surprised by what?
Very funny, Émile. Battle stations. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Mind if I sit with you two?
I have no problem with that! Do you, Capitaine?
Not at all. Take a seat.
Thanks! Oh! Émile, you've barely touched your food!
Oui, je sais. I've spent a lot of time with some of my blueprints today.
Blueprints? Mind if I- Oh, wait, I think I recognize some of those parts sketched on there...
You have a keen eye! They're-
Morgana! That's where I've seen those parts! What's going on!?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing to concern yourself with.
Émile is just theorizing potential ways to give us advantages in battle.
Morgana tech. She wants to incorporate it with the vessel.

Fields.DialogueText: Ok... It's... I don't know... I'm gonna head out. Suddenly I'm not too hungry...
Looks more like ways to destroy us from the inside to me...
Haha! Wait... you're serious...
I'm just gonna go.... With your permission, Captain?
Of course.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I really appreciate how open to communication a lot of the Belles have been recently!
This is about your... research?
Oui et non. It's about everything! The longer the war goes on, the easier it is to talk to German or Soviet Belles the way I would to a Brit!
There's so much we can learn from each other, Capitaine. I know you understand that better than anyone.

Fields.MenuText: Do you ever wonder if you would've felt the same way if the Morganas hadn't come along?
Don't see the point in that...
It's shocking that you'd be so open... even in times like these.

Fields.DialogueText: That would've been a different world, Capitaine. In some ways, maybe a sadder one.
Information, secrets, anything that benefits everyone!
What can I say? I guess I'm too nice!
Would you chat with the Morganas too? If they didn't just sail up, threaten you, and start shooting?
Non! Mais... Capitaine, think about all the things they might know!
Please don't get any bright ideas...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Incoming Morganas, Capitaine!
Let's make this quick!
@BATTLE
Looks like there are only a few left! We could hunt them down if we're quick, sir.
Understood. Émile. Get-
I wonder why they do this...
Émile?
I wish there could be a way to-
We gotta act now or else they'll get away!

Fields.MenuText: Émile! Snap out of it! Focus!
With or without you, I'm finishing this, Émile!
Please don't be lost in thought...

Fields.DialogueText: Ahh! Pardon! Let's finish this!
Pardonnez-moi! It won't happen again!
Pardon, Capitaine! I'm with you!
Disregard. Looks like we lost our moment.
Standing down, sir.
Désolée, Capitaine...
*ALARM*
Look sharp, Émile!
Quoi? Oh! Oui, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
What was that all about earlier?
What are you talking about?

Fields.MenuText: You spaced out during that fight. That can't happen. What's wrong?
Are you going to be able to fight? I can't afford our Belle to be lost in thought.
You know what I'm talking about. That last fight. What happened?

Fields.DialogueText: Well...
I can still fight, sir! I promise! It's just...
The last fight? Oh...
I was deep in thought about what you said to me recently - about talking to them... to the Morganas.
Actually talking to them...
Émile... wanting to put some salvaged weapons on the ship is one thing-
Mais...
But communicating with them like other Belles? Unless you count False Hope, which I don't, that... doesn't generally end well.
I know...
Seriously, at least for the time being, don't pursue that idea. Do you understand me?
Oui, Capitaine.
I had no idea! That's incredible! You took me by shock, Émile!
What can I say? I have many hobbies! Language is just one of them.
What's going on here?
Bonjour, Capitaine!
Captain! Pleasure to see you!
You sounded startled. What happened?
I was muttering to myself in my native language, when all of a sudden Émile started speaking Japanese! She understood everything I was saying!

Fields.MenuText: Really? Émile, how come this never came up?
That's quite impressive, Émile! Think you could teach me?
That's actually fairly common among the Belles. They all seem to be able to understand their crews.

Fields.DialogueText: Je ne sais pas. I don't know, sir, but you never asked!
Me?! Impressive! Oh, sir! You're too kind! I'd love to teach you sometime!
C'est vrai! But it's always a joy to hear something new.
Anyways... Shall we head to the cafeteria, sir? I'm hungry!
With your history, I'd never stop you from eating a meal.
As long as I don't get distracted from here to the mess hall.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hello, Captain. Unusual to see you here around this time, sir.
Just a touch of insomnia, Navarra. What about you - your shift's done, isn't it?
Listen, would you have a moment? There's some concerning rumors going around regarding our Belle.
What kind of rumors?
That she's planning to incorporate scavenged Morgana parts from her collection to our ship.
At this stage, she's just theorizing.
I see... but tell me, sir - if this were a possibility, would you allow such a thing?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know... my gut says no, but she's the one who'd be assuming the most immediate risk.
Maybe, provided that the entire crew would be willing to accept the risk.
We've taken all kinds of prizes from destroyed Morganas - the weapons and artifacts they stole from us first. The consensus is they can't easily contaminate objects in any fundamental way.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, the risk seems pretty immediate to everyone on board.
... You're a commendable leader, Captain. But I don't think you would find the crew agreeing to it.
What?! You seriously can't allow this, sir.
Ensign, your position is noted. But I'm afraid it's not your call.
Please, sir... just... don't put all of us at an even greater risk.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Yes, but I thought I'd take in some air.
If some Morgana gun makes it through containment and observation protocols without raising red flags, there's an argument to be made that we'd be remiss not to test it.
Sir, Morganas spotted due east.
Sound the alarm.
@BATTLE
Hmm... I heard you've skipped a meal, sir. Usually it's you lecturing me about that, especially after a combat.
That's true...
Quelque chose vous dérange, Capitaine? You look gloomy.
Do you know Ensign Navarra?
Oui, I am familiar with him. I've spoken with him and his shipmates from time to time.
Did you tell them about your designs with the Morgana parts?
Of course I did! After I heavily critiqued the way everyone functions, I suggested better alternatives to help us!

Fields.MenuText: You have to be careful about whom you tell, Émile. Rumors could get out of control very quickly.
I think our superiors would like me to remind you that we don't generally share information about special weapon programs.
Don't talk about your blueprints that feature Morgana equipment. It's to avoid a headache...

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I guess that makes a bit of sense...
Oh... I think I understand...
Headache? Why would... oh! Je comprends!
Don't worry, sir! I'll try to be a bit more quiet from now on!
Discretion from here on out, Émile.
Sir, we have contacts off the starboard bow.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Was that a knock? Come on in.
Just me, Capitaine - your favorite Belle! Can I share with you the latest progress on my designs?
Another breakthrough?
Another package!
More junked Morgana scrap, I'm guessing.
Oui! From another Belle who's interested in the Morganas! She gave me some of their equipment that got fished out of the sea!
How dreadfully nice of her.
I think my blueprint is almost complete... I've been busy as of late... Soon I'd like to have a serious discussion with you, sir.

Fields.MenuText: You? Serious? I guess there's a first time for everything...
Best we get it resolved soon, so that you don't blank out in the middle of any more battles...
As long as it's quick.

Fields.DialogueText: I've been plenty serious, sir! Look how diligent I am!
That only happened once! It hasn't happened since!
It will be! I promise!
You may wish to begin thinking about how to address the crew on this matter as well, Capitaine. I mean, just in case you give me permission to proceed.
Very well. All hands to battle stations.
Thanks for the warning, Émile.
I'm ready to show you my finished design, sir! As well as my plans!
Go ahead. Brief me, Émile.
So from all the parts I've gathered I think we could replicate the type of ammo they use... and even some of their structural design.
Really? What's the benefit from doing that?
The Morganas seem to utilize space relatively well... This allows for some tiny yet significant upgrades to their weapons and structural integrity.
That's why even if we face similar models, they're stronger?
Correct! We could absolutely lift their design and improve our durability! Not to mention our firepower! I even managed to scrounge up a Morgana radar!
What's the use of that?
If we integrate it, we could trick their radars into thinking we're friendly! We get the drop on them!
That's not generally how radar works.
Surely it's worth a shot! What do you say? Let's turn me into a lean, mean, Morgana machine!

Fields.MenuText: "Let's turn me into a Morgana" is a terrible sales line. Just for the record.
Your plans seem thorough - but I still don't have the consent of the crew.
I need you to prove you have some self-control, Émile.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I could help with that!
Not my best quality...
Enh. C'est vrai - but you know what I mean!
*ALARM*
Look sharp, Émile. We have incoming hostiles.
@BATTLE
Human detection systems, non. But I think this may have a kind of unique broadcast signature that they can pick up - their senses are very interesting, Capitaine!
You realize, Capitaine, that my plans could make these battles less frequent.
Let's just get through this one without you chirping in my ear about Morgana parts!
@BATTLE
Well? Have you come to a decision, sir?

Fields.MenuText: I'm game. Start making the necessary preparations.
You've done a lot of planning. If you really think this will help, I'm in.
The second this backfires, we stop. Understand?

Fields.DialogueText: Bon! You won't be sorry, Capitaine! I promise! This has to work!
It will! We'd be crazy to ignore this!
Je comprends!
I'm glad you're allowing this. Your trust hasn't been misplaced!
What are we going to do about the engineers and the crew?
At the next resupply, I'll see what I can do. I'll chat with some engineers on board... Convincing Officer Navarra and the others, though - that I must leave to you.
Yeah. I'm really looking forward to that.
What's the worst that can happen? Mutiny? You get labeled a traitor? I get scrapped? Nothing too out of the ordinary!
You've got to be joking...
Let's get to work, then! We'll reconvene when everything is all set! I'm so excited!
I should tell you that I've conferred with Command. They're... more excited about this than I am, to be honest.
Formidable! So that's a "oui?"
Is it true, sir?
What?
That you're allowing Émile to go through with that ridiculous plan of hers?!
Not just me. The word came down from on high - but it's a decision I support.
A decision that could jeopardize the entire crew! I won't stand for this!
Why not?
Who knows what could happen?! Maybe it could change Émile! She could start sympathizing with the Morganas!

Fields.MenuText: Are you seriously afraid that Émile will be brainwashed by a piece of technology? The Morganas aren't magic! You're paranoid!
I have a handle on the situation, Navarra. I'm just asking for you to trust me.
This is so she doesn't get any more ideas like this. What if it ends up helping us?

Fields.DialogueText: We just can't be sure what might happen. I'm not afraid, but... can we just attach things to the ships willy-nilly?
I-I... Hm... I guess I can't stop it now...
Then... well...
I sincerely hope you know what you're doing, sir. You're on your own when it comes to the rest of the crew...
Noted, Officer Navarra. Now get to your post. I expect we'll have enemy contact at any moment.
Aye, sir...
@BATTLE
So how'd it go?
With Officer Navarra? It went... about as I expected.
I'm guessing that means he's not for it?
No, he's not... but he'll obey me. He's not insubordinate.
Great! I'm so excited!

Fields.MenuText: What about you? What do you need to do?
Anything you need help with?
Are you sure everything is going to be okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Still waiting on our resupply! But my chat with some of the engineers on the ship went well! They're interested!
Non! Everything's going smoothly!
Mais oui! Trust me, Capitaine. This will work!
You still need to convince the crew, don't you?
I wish I had the time to chat with all of them individually...
You don't have to! Word around here spreads fast! You get a few to side with your choice, the rest will trust you!
Mm. I've always admired your optimism.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Whew! I have an excuse to procrastinate now...
Convince? No. Reassure, maybe.
Um... Excuse me, sir...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Can I help you?
There's been a lot of talk around the ship. We've heard some things from Officer Navarra and even Émile...
Go ahead. Speak your mind.
Are we really going to allow functioning Morgana tech in this vessel?
Is that what you are looking for? An assurance of safety?
People are concerned, is all... will everyone be okay?

Fields.MenuText: Trust me. I wouldn't do this if I didn't have total faith in Émile.
You don't need to worry. I have everything under control.
As long as everyone keeps up and gives their all, this won't be an issue!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... okay... I guess that puts my mind at ease. If you're this confident then we have nothing to worry about!
That's what I was hoping you'd say, sir! I know you won't let us down!
Business as usual? We can keep doing that! You can count on all of us to stay alert, sir!
It may not seem like much, but you sound so assured about this. We have faith, sir!
Glad to hear it!
Find me after the fight, sailor.
We're supplementing some of the existing armor and we're testing what we take to be a Morgana radar - but it's not being integrated into the ship's primary electrical system.
That's what the backup generator is for.
None of it's radioactive, the scientists back home have found no health risks to exposure, and it's all been designed so it can be disabled and thrown off the ship in under five minutes.
So... it's safe?
Sir, Morganas straight ahead.
All crew, prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
People are excited, Capitaine!
I know...
The crew assured me that they're all here for me! They trust me!

Fields.MenuText: I guess word spread fast about my confidence.
It's because they believe in your judgement, Émile.
You're welcome.

Fields.DialogueText: Je sais! Whatever you did worked flawlessly!
C'est vrai? That's so sweet of them!
Merci beaucoup!
So what's next?
When we resupply, I think that'll be the time our engineers can get to work!
I guess this is really happening.
Isn't it exciting?! I can't wait to attach all of that Morgana junk to myself and see what happens!
Please try to find another way to say things like that.
Pourqoui?
*sigh*
Soon these fights will get much easier.
Until then, let's give 'em hell.
@BATTLE
C'est l'heure! The engineers have my blueprint and I'm on my way down to help!
Be careful. Be alert. If you have even the slightest sense that anything is amiss-
Think of the possibilities! Will this help?! I hope so! I bet we'll notice right away!

Fields.MenuText: Listen, there's still time to back out of this.
I'm serious. Let me know if it doesn't feel right.
Are you nervous?

Fields.DialogueText: Absurdité! It's happening!
Bien sûr! Thank you for your concern!
Hmm... non! Not really...
So is this gonna take long?
It's a straightforward operation, so non. Everything will be okay! After it's done, I'll make sure to check in on you! Je promets!
Okay...
Oh, boy.
You don't look so different, except for a few pieces of Morgana junk bolted here and there... So?
So what, Capitaine?
Do you feel... different?
J'ai un peu faim - I am a bit hungry. I'm kinda tired too. But that's not unusual!
So you feel normal, then?
Yes, rather normal! I can't wait to see if this works!

Fields.MenuText: I wonder if this actually did anything...
I can't either. But we gotta be extra careful, Émile.
So... you haven't been brainwashed?

Fields.DialogueText: I do, too... only time will tell!
I know we do, silly! I'm not a kid!
Brainwashed? Haha! That's a good one! I'm still the same old Émile! Just fancier!
Wait... we have Morganas nearby...
But the alarm didn't go off-
They're close... I know their distance... numbers... we gotta move! Let's get the jump on them!
@BATTLE
Are you ready for more combat, Capitaine?
Let's show them what you've got.
@BATTLE
Well... letting you experiment with Morgana scrap didn't get us all killed. Command will be pleased.
Didn't the Morganas seem confused to you? I bet their heads spun when they saw how we crept up on them!
And how do you feel? Fatigued?
C'est exactement le contraire! It wasn't as stressful for me as it usually is! Maybe because there are fewer unknown variables!
I'll be honest. I'm obviously not the Belle, but I didn't notice any significant improvement to fire control, or handling, or... really any combat performance.
Well... non. But I think we gained a certain stealth benefit. The Morganas take more time to recognize us!

Fields.MenuText: Well... at least it doesn't seem to make it easier for them to detect us.
I'm still worried. Are you positive that you're feeling well?
I was right to trust in you, Émile. You're truly a wonderful Belle...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I'm sure it's more than that!
Don't worry! Je me sens bien! It worked out! Yay!
It is nothing, sir! I don't know what to say! Merci, Capitaine! I might cry from joy!
Nice job, Émile. Get some rest.
Merci!
(I don't think the Morgana scrap disguised us or fooled them... but I'll let her enjoy the placebo effect... for now.)
... Okay.
... Don't you think?
The Morganas won't know what hit them!
@BATTLE
Heard the latest scuttlebutt? Sounds like the crew is excited...
Oui? About what, Capitaine?
Just listen.
Émile made her project work! I can't believe I ever doubted her!
I know! She made history! We have to find some way to celebrate!
We should buy her a drink! I wonder what she likes?

Fields.MenuText: Seems like you're more of an inspiration to them than me. It's well deserved!
We should celebrate.
I'm glad you were so persistent in this.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know about that... but merci, Capitaine!
Absolument! How about I go over some of my input for how we should operate more efficiently?!
Et moi aussi!
All hands! To battle stations!
Just enjoy yourself a bit, Émile.
Is Émile in my quarters again?
Émile! What're you doing?
Excusez-moi! I'm working on a new blueprint!

Fields.MenuText: You really don't stop, do you?

Fields.DialogueText: Why would I? We've made great progress! I'm trying to think of how we can-- Oh!
What's wrong?!
I haven't eaten at all today...
You never change, Émile. Let's go get something to eat...

Fields.MenuText: I forbid it. I have indulged you enough.
Didn't I order to you to take a break?

Fields.DialogueText: Awww... S'il vous plaît, Capitaine?
If you did, I may not have been listening, Capitaine. Désolée...
